item.title: Please ask the council cleaning services to give attention to detail, 1st August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Kelly Avenue, Peckham, London

item.title: 34 Mapesbury Road, 1st August
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, We need to report the fact that our neighbours consistently contaminate their (blue lidded) recycling bin. As follows: Our neighbours do not use the blue sack issued by Brent Council and Veolia and are contaminating their recycling bin by putting paper and cardboard, in with the plastics and tin cans. As a result, they are contaminating every 2 weekly recycling collection and this has been going on for over a year. We have spoken to Veolia regarding this matter and were advised to contact Brent Council. So, we reported the issue to our Housing Officer, Ms Cassandra Mills, but she never got back to us. We then reported the issue to Brent Council Recycling Team, on Thursday 10/07/2025, and we were given the following reference number: 19476594. However, on the following collection day, Tuesday 15/07/2025, the contaminated recycling was collected and emptied as normal. These are his details: Mr Jeremy Lever, 34a Mapesbury Road, NW2 4JD. Most of the other residents of Brent are conscientious enough to seperate their waste responsibly. This needs to stop before the next recycling collection takes place and yet another lorry load of recycling is contaminated. The links below provides access to CCTV footage, multiple images clearly showing our neighbours putting the wrong waste in the wrong bin as well as photos of the contents of their blue bin and footage of their blue bin being collected. Https://we.tl/t-UNsDvJQnpw Https://we.tl/t-TT3z14T46u Please do not hesitate to contact us should you require any further information or wish to view the other evidence we have accumulated. Kind regards, Ian Stevenson and Jane Morgan Townshend.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
